description: [Status: stable] [Name: comparison-with-itself] [Message: Name compared with itself, consider replacing {actual}] What it does Checks for operations that compare a name to itself. Why is this bad? Comparing a name to itself always results in the same value, and is likely a mistake. Example foo == foo In some cases, self-comparisons are used to determine whether a float is NaN. Instead, prefer math.isnan: import math math.isnan(foo)
